question: Which two countries are native to the "Susu people"?
explanation: The Susu people are a Mande ethnic group living primarily in Guinea and Northwestern Sierra Leone. Influential in Guinea, smaller communities of Susu people are also found in the neighbouring Guinea-Bissau and Senegal. The Susu are a patrilineal society, predominantly Muslim, who favour endogamous cross-cousin marriages with polygynous households. They have a caste system like all Manding-speaking peoples of West Africa.
